42c027e4ff9730fbb3de84c1af0d2c506e41c3e4:
Daniel Radcliffe gains £20M at 18 but vows to stay grounded.  
He avoids extravagance, preferring books and CDs over luxury.  
Radcliffe plans a low-key birthday party, avoiding media attention.  
He continues acting beyond Harry Potter, with new film projects.
ee8871b15c50d0db17b0179a6d2beab35065f1e9:
Mentally ill inmates are housed on Miami's "forgotten floor" jail, often arrested for avoidable felonies.  
Judge Leifman advocates for change, noting the system is overwhelmed by mentally ill prisoners.  
A new mental health facility aims to provide treatment instead of repeated jail cycles.  
The shift could save money, help patients, and serve justice more effectively.
06352019a19ae31e527f37f7571c6dd7f0c5da37:
Drivers describe terrifying bridge collapse with cars falling into water.  
Rescuers quickly mobilized, saving 55 people amid chaos and injuries.  
Survivors recall moments of free-fall, disbelief, and heroic rescues.  
Eyewitnesses say the scene was surreal, like a movie.
24521a2abb2e1f5e34e6824e0f9e56904a2b0e88:
President Bush had five small colon polyps removed; none appeared concerning.  
He resumed normal activities at Camp David after the routine procedure.  
Vice President Cheney briefly assumed presidential duties during the exam.  
Bush's last colonoscopy was in 2002, with no prior abnormalities found.
7fe70cc8b12fab2d0a258fababf7d9c6b5e1262a:
NFL suspends Michael Vick indefinitely without pay for dogfighting involvement.  
Vick admits to killing underperforming dogs and agrees to plead guilty.  
He faces up to five years in prison and a $250,000 fine.  
Falcons may seek $22M in bonus money from Vick's contract.
